name: Cable Crunch
guide:
Cable crunches are an excellent workout with cables to improve core strength. They focus on the sides of your core, also known as your obliques.

1. Kneel in front of a cable machine and grab the rope attachment.
2. Hold the rope by your ears, keeping your elbows bent.
3. Engage your core and crunch downwards, bringing your elbows towards your thighs.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.

name: Plank
guide:
The plank is an isometric core strength exercise that involves maintaining a position similar to a push-up for the maximum possible time.

1. Start in a push-up position with your arms straight and hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Lower your forearms to the ground, keeping your elbows directly beneath your shoulders.
3. Engage your core and maintain a straight line from your head to your heels.
4. Hold the position for the maximum possible time.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
guide:
Hanging leg raises are an effective core exercise that targets the lower abdominal muscles and hip flexors. By hanging from a pull-up bar, you use your core strength to lift your legs towards your chest. This exercise improves overall core stability, strength, and flexibility in the hip region.

1. Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended.
2. Engage your core and slowly lift your legs towards your chest.
3. Hold the position briefly.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
guide:
The dumbbell bicep curl is versatile and effective for targeting the biceps. It allows a natural range of motion, reducing injury risk and promoting balanced muscle development in both arms.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells with an underhand grip.
2. Keep your elbows close to your sides and curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
guide:
The hammer curl targets the biceps and the brachialis muscle, using a neutral grip. This exercise is excellent for promoting arm strength and size, as well as improving forearm stability.

1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells with a neutral grip.
2. Keep your elbows close to your sides and curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Cable Bar Bicep Curl
guide:
Using a bar attachment, the cable bicep curl provides constant tension on the biceps throughout the movement.

1. Stand in front of a cable machine with the bar attached to the low pulley.
2. Hold the bar with an underhand grip, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
3. Curl the bar towards your shoulders.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.

name: Machine Preacher Curl
guide:
The machine preacher curl isolates the biceps, emphasizing strict form and controlled movement. This exercise targets the lower biceps, promoting muscle growth and definition.

1. Sit on the preacher curl machine and adjust the seat height.
2. Hold the handles with an underhand grip.
3. Curl the handles towards your shoulders.
4. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position.

name: Machine Seated Calf Raise
guide:
The machine seated calf raise targets the soleus muscle more effectively due to the bent knee position. This exercise is performed using a seated calf raise machine, providing a focused workout for the lower part of the calves.

1. Sit on the machine with your knees under the pads and your feet on the footplate.
2. Position the balls of your feet on the edge of the footplate.
3. Push through your toes to lift your heels, contracting your calf muscles.
4. Slowly lower your heels back to the starting position.

name: Machine Standing Calf Raise
guide:
The machine standing calf raise is an effective exercise for targeting the calf muscles, particularly the gastrocnemius. By using a standing calf raise machine, you can lift heavier weights with proper form, enhancing muscle growth and strength.

1. Position yourself in the standing calf raise machine with your shoulders under the pads and the balls of your feet on the footplate.
2. Keep your legs straight but not locked.
3. Push through the balls of your feet to lift your heels, contracting your calf muscles.
4. Slowly lower your heels back to the starting position.

name: Cable Fly
guide:
The mid cable fly (crossover) targets the middle portion of the chest, emphasizing the central pectoral muscles. This exercise provides a balanced workout for the chest and is performed using a cable machine.

1. Set the cable pulleys to chest height and attach handles.
2. Stand in the center, holding the handles with your arms extended out to the sides.
3. Bring the handles together in front of your body, crossing them slightly.
4. Squeeze your chest muscles at the peak of the movement.
5. Slowly return to the starting position with control.

name: Dumbbell Incline Bench Press
guide:
The dumbbell incline bench press targets the upper portion of the chest and shoulders. Performing this exercise on an incline bench emphasizes the upper chest muscles.

1. Set an adjustable bench to a 30-45 degree incline and lie back with a dumbbell in each hand, held at chest level.
2. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended.
3. Squeeze your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Incline Fly
guide:
The dumbbell incline fly is an isolation exercise targeting the upper portion of the pectoral muscles. By performing this exercise on an incline bench, you emphasize the upper chest, which helps in developing a fuller, more defined chest. This movement also engages the shoulders and stabilizer muscles, promoting overall upper body strength and stability.

1. Set an adjustable bench to a 30-45 degree incline and lie back with a dumbbell in each hand, held above your chest with your palms facing each other.
2. Lower the dumbbells in a wide arc to the sides, maintaining a slight bend in your elbows.
3. Lower until you feel a stretch in your chest muscles.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together in a wide arc, squeezing your chest muscles at the top.
5. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, ensuring controlled movement throughout.

name: Machine Fly (Pec Dec)
guide:
The machine fly, or pec deck, is an isolation exercise that targets the pectoral muscles. This exercise helps develop the chest muscles by providing a focused movement that isolates the pecs, allowing for a deep stretch and strong contraction.

1. Adjust the seat height so that the handles are at chest level when you sit down.
2. Sit on the machine with your back firmly against the pad and grip the handles with your palms facing forward.
3. Bring the handles together in front of your chest, keeping a slight bend in your elbows throughout the movement.
4. Squeeze your chest muscles at the peak of the movement.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position, ensuring a controlled motion.
6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Machine Seated Chest Press
guide:
The seated chest press machine is a fundamental exercise for building chest strength and mass. It targets the pectoral muscles, triceps, and shoulders, providing a safe and controlled range of motion.

1. Adjust the seat height of the chest press machine and select the appropriate weight.
2. Sit down and grasp the handles with an overhand grip.
3. Press the handles forward, extending your arms fully.
4. Squeeze your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly return the handles to the starting position.

name: Cable Lateral Pull Down Wide-Grip
guide: The Lat pull down is a compound exercise designed to target many muscles of the back, most notably the latissimus dorsi. This exercise can be completed using a lat pulldown bar, a D-handle bar, a champion pro-style lat bar, or a V-bar.

name: Cable V-Handle Seated Row
guide: The Cable row is an essential exercise to strengthen the upper body, primarily targeting the muscles in the back and biceps. To perform you can use various types of cable bars.

name: Cable Rope Straight Arm Pull Down
Trap Bar Deadlift
guide: Deadlifts are an essential exercise that help build both strength and muscle. They can be completed with dumbbells, a barbell, a trap bar or cables. The exercise focuses on your whole body, with an emphasis on your lower back.

name: Back Extension (Hyperextension)
guide: While lying on an inclined bench or extension machine, slowly lower your body towards the floor, bending at the hips. Ensure your back is kept straight throughout the exercise.

name: Machine Leg Press
guide: Leg press is a very effective leg and quadricep exercise. Using your legs push outward against the machine to fully engage your quadriceps and leg muscles.

name: Machine Leg Extension
guide: Leg extensions are a very effective leg and quadricep exercise. Using your legs extend upward against the padded machine to fully engage your quadriceps and leg muscles.

name: Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat
guide: Bulgarian split squats are an advanced lower body exercise that can be completed with dumbbells. They place an emphasis on the front of your legs.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
guide: Lateral raises are an isolated movement that focus on the sides of your shoulders by building muscle and toning. They are completed with dumbbells.

name: Dumbbell Front Raise
guide: Front raises are an isolated movement that focus on the front of your shoulders by building muscle and toning. They are completed with dumbbells.

name: Dumbbell Shrug
guide:
The Shoulder Shrug is a critical exercise in strengthening the shoulders and developing the upper trapezius muscle. It can be performed with a barbell, dumbbells, trap bar, resistance bands, parallel bar, or a smith machine.

To effectively shoulder shrug you must stand tall with hands placed shoulder width apart, and slowly raise the shoulders as high as possible, before slowly lowering them back to starting position.

name: Barbell Shrug
guide:
The Shoulder Shrug is a critical exercise in strengthening the shoulders and developing the upper trapezius muscle. It can be performed with a barbell, dumbbells, trap bar, resistance bands, parallel bar, or a smith machine.

To effectively shoulder shrug you must stand tall with hands placed shoulder width apart, and slowly raise the shoulders as high as possible, before slowly lowering them back to starting position.

name: Dips
guide: Dips are an essential upper body strength exercise that primarily focuses on triceps and anterior deltoids. This can be performed either with a bench/raised platform or a dip rack.

name: Bench Dips
guide: Dips are an essential upper body strength exercise that primarily focuses on triceps and anterior deltoids. This can be performed either with a bench/raised platform or a dip rack.

name: Cable V-Bar Overhead Tricep Extension Low
guide: Tricep extensions are an excellent push-type isolation exercise which works on triceps, shoulders, chest, lats, and forearms. Can be performed with a cable in a higher or lower position.

name: Cable Rope Tricep Pushdown Extension
guide: Tricep extensions are an excellent push-type isolation exercise which works on triceps, shoulders, chest, lats, and forearms. Can be performed with a cable in a higher or lower position.
